request.description: This request is just to verify that backend server is running and api is running properly.

body.raw:
{
    "userName" : "Application Super Admin", 
    "userEmail" : "abgadmin@gmail.com", 
    "phoneNumber" : 9456767676, 
    "userRole" : "Super Admin", 
    "userPassword" : "admin123", 
    "businessEntity" : "ABG", 
    "createdBy" : {
        "creatingUserName" : "Application Super Admin",
        "creatingUserRole" : "Application Super Admin",
        "creatingUserBusinessEntity" : "ABG"
    }, 
    "cretedOn" : "13",
    "userStatus": "active"
}

request.description:
This route is used to add the credentials for a new user.  
This route require an authentication token in the headers while sending all the details. The data send will be in the req body form in the json format as shown in the example.
This route will be used to login into the system using the "userEmail" and "userPassword" as req body.

This route is used to get all the users details. Including their roles and permissions.  
This route will also require an authentication token to validate the user.

This route is used to get all the users details for a particular Business Entity (only user details excluding permissions) on the basis of the business entity name. Business Entity name is send in the params with the request.  
This route will also require an authentication token in the headers to validate the user.

item.name: USER => Find Single User by ID

request.description:
This route is used to get the user details for a particular Business Entity (only user details excluding permissions) on the basis of the user _id. _id for that user is send in the params with the request.  
This route will also require an authentication token in the headers to validate the user.

body.raw:
{
    "userName" : "Application Super Admin",
    "phoneNumber" : "0987654321",
    "userPassword" : "admin123",
    "userStatus" : "Active",
    "userRole" : "ABG Super Admin",
    "userEmail" : "abgadmin@gmail.com",
    "loggedInUser": "Application Super Admin"
}

request.description:
This route is used to update the user details for a particular user (only user details excluding permissions can be edited) on the basis of the user _id. _id for that user is send in the params with the request. Also, only the user who has created that user can edit the user details.  
This route will also require an authentication token in the headers to validate the user.

This is the simple get logout route to logout the user and end the token session.

This will also require an authentication token to logout.

This route is used to add the Business Entity details.

We will be needing the token for authentication while using this route so kindly login 1st to use this route.

Sending all the data in the req body of the form in the json format to save it in the db.

item.name: BE => Get All Business Entity Data

request.description: This route is used to get all the details of the Business Entities in our system. This also requires an authentication to get the response.

item.name: BE => Get Data for a single Business Entity

request.description:
This route is used to get all the data of a single business entity by it's name.  
Sending the "companyName" in the params to find the data for a single business enity. This also requires an authentication token to access the data.

item.name: BE => Update a single Business Entity

request.description:
This route is used to edit the single Business Entity details. We are sending the business entity id in the req params and all the details to update inside the req body.
This route will use an authentication token to use it.
This get route is used to get all the data for the services inside the service catelogue.
This get route is used to fetch the data for all the active services.

This post route is used to add a new service data in the service catelogue database. We are sending all the data in the req body in the same format as ashown in the example. 
This route can only be used by the super admin till now.
Also, service name should be unique while enting the data.
This route will require an authentication token to use.

item.name: SERVICE => Get Data for a Single Service

request.description:
This get route is used to fetch the data for a single service by its _id.  
Sending the "id" in the req params to get all the data by the service name.  
This route will require an authentication token to use it.

This route will be used to update a single service using its service id. 
Seding the service id into the req params along with all the data of the service into the req body.
This route needs an authentication token to use it.

This get api is used to get all the roles and permissions in our db.
This route needs an authentication token to access the data.

This get route is used to get all the roles only on the basis of the business entity.  
Sending the business entity name inside the req params.  
This route will require an authentication token to fetch the data.

This get route is used to get all the roles and permissions on the basis of the business entity name.  
Sending the business entity name inside the req params.  
This route will require an authentication token to fetch the data.

This route is used to add a new role and its permissions into our database.
Sending all the required fields into the req body as given in the example.
This route will require an authentication token to send the data.

This get routes find the individual role and its pemissions using its unique id.
We are sending the role id in the req params. 
This route will require an authentication token to validate the user.

item.name: RBAC => Update the Role and its Permissions

request.description:
This route is used to update the values of a role and its permissions. 
The condition rn here is only that person can update it who has created this role. 
Sending the role id in the req params and rest all the data in the req body.
This route will require an authentication token to validate and perform the changes.
